entry.title: Batch Jobs for processing Billing document of Billing Document Requests
entry.content:
Hi SAP gurus,

My client has asked for a way to schedule batch jobs for creating billing documents of service contract.
The Billing Document Requests will be created via the app Schedule Billing Document Request Creation (Services Contract) manually as needed by client.
I want to use app Schedule Billing Creation to create billing documents of service contract.
At the same time, I want to collect   Billing Document Requests of service contract only.
Could you tell me how to set parameters?
We use the billing type of billing document is F2.

 

Thanks Lily

entry.title: Custom Field in Migration template
entry.content:
I create a custom field via Custom Fields app. And that field appears in Migration template.

Issue is that if we don't fill value to that custom field, can't upload the migration template. 

I don't set as mandatory to custom field.

Could you please help me to solve this issue?

Best Regards.

Khaing Zin

entry.title: How to add calculation field and code in Custom CDS view
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We need to add calculation field in Custom CDS view, could you please guide us how to write the code?

For example, if the Debit/credit code = "H", then the quantity = Quantity * (-1). 

Is there any document to explain the coding for Custom CDS view? Thank you.

Best Regards,

Grace

entry.title: SAP Cloud - Multiple Delivery addresses in Purchase Order
entry.content:
Dear community, 

our client is on SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public Edition.

We are facing the following challenge: We have 1 storage location but 6-8 different delivery points within the same storage location. We need the delivery address to be entered in the Purchase Order and print it on the PO form so that the supplier can send the goods to the right place.

As per standard, the delivery address in the PO is taken from the storage location (SLOC Configuration) - and we can maintain only one address for the SLOC in customizing. Of course, one possibility is to create an address table entry for each delivery point. The purchase could enter the address number during  PO creation. But that would mean that the PO creator has manual work: the right address needs to be entered n in each PO...

Does anyone have any idea to avoid or at least minimize the manual efforts?

Thanks and regards,

We should be able to see the Header text & PR creator & some fields directly in the Approval Task Card while approving the PO the sample is  attached for your reference.

entry.title: Inability to modify BP Bank Account on KA journal entry type via "edit line items"
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently facing a functional limitation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition  related to the modification of the bank account on KA journal entry type documents.

üß≠ Functional Context

Previously, it was possible to edit the bank account (RIB) on KA journal entries using the ‚ÄúManage Supplier Line Items‚Äù app and the ‚Äúedit line items‚Äù function.
Interestingly, the same modification still works for ZP journal entry type, which has been confirmed through user testing.

üìåCustomer Case

  • The issue was observed while trying to update the BP Bank Account  for suppliers.
  • The system throws an error when attempting to modify the RIB via ‚Äúedit line items‚Äù.
  • Example error message:
    ‚ÄúImpossible de modifier Cpte bq parten. pour le poste 1700000079/2025/001‚Äù
    (Unable to change bank account for item 1700000079/2025/001)

‚ö†Ô∏èBusiness Impact

  • The KA journal entry type is mandatory for vendor down payments.
  • This restriction prevents users from correcting or updating the RIB, which can lead to:
    • Payments being sent to incorrect bank accounts
    • Delays in payment processing
    • Reduced reliability of vendor banking data

üìùAdditional Notes

  • Previously, we were able to modify the RIB on both KA and ZP entries.
  • These entries allowed RIB modification in the past. However, recent tests in the quality environment using similar journal entry types no longer allow RIB modification for KA entries.

‚ùìRequest for Insights

We would appreciate any feedback or clarification from the community or SAP experts on the following points:

  1. Is this a new limitation introduced in version 2502, or a bug?
  2. Is this behavior now considered standard SAP for KA journal entry type?
  3. Are there any planned enhancements to restore RIB modification for KA entries?
  4. What workarounds or configuration options exist to address this issue?

Thank you in advance for your support and insights!
‚Äî Anis BEN SALEM, Senior Associate

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud leading ledger HGB
entry.content:
Dear all

can you pls help with some information on the leading GAAP for companys with group GAAP HGB?

Previous post https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/second-ledger-hgb/qaq-p/12495714 states that we need to use one of the existing GAAPS for 0L (IFRS or US-GAAP) and to  adapt the IFRS principles to your DEAP needs for all company codes in ledger 0L.

Is still to be applied to HGB companies? 

BR

Carolin

entry.title: Receipt of PT in another plant and its warehouse
entry.content:
Good day team,
Could you please help me by indicating what configuration I need?

The scenario is as follows:
I create an order for a customer at plant 5510, which doesn't manufacture, but I have another plant that does manufacture 55MY, and my manufacturing is against orders.

1.Therefore, since my manufacturing is made to order and my client is from plant 5510, I create an order for plant 5510.

2.In my planned order I notice that I can change to plant 55MY, which is where I manufacture the PT, but it doesn't let me select its corresponding warehouse 55LS. However, I leave it empty to see if I can indicate the warehouse in the entry.

3.My raw material is consumed at plant 55MY and warehouse 55LS and it is correct.

4.My time ticket is also correct and shows me as being at the 55MY plant.

5.The problem arises when I want to enter the PT and it won't let me change the plant 55MY, but the strange thing is that the warehouse 55LS has already arrived, obviously if I want to account for it it won't let me because it tells me that the warehouse doesn't belong with the plant.

Why won't it let me change the plant?

What do I need to configure so that I can change the plant and be able to account in warehouse 55SL?

üòû

 

NOTE:

The curious thing is that in my master data I left the production storage location field empty in both plant 5510 and plant 55MY and as you can see the system in the PT receipt did add warehouse 55SL.

Why did it do that?

üòû

entry.title: C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY_CDS - "Expression.Error: Access to the resource is forbidden"
entry.content:
Hello,

We're trying to connect the CDS view C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY with Power BI using the OData feed.

Although this CDS view works correctly in the browser via the browser application, it fails when connecting through Power BI, with the following error: "Expression.Error: Access to the resource is forbidden".

Upon analysis, we observed that this CDS view is not part of any active communication scenario in the system. We have the following queries:

  1. Is there a recommended standard communication scenario that includes C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY as an inbound OData service?

  2. If not, can SAP include this service in one of the standard supported scenarios?

We've searched in the API Hub with C_SALESVOLUMEANALYSISQUERY, but could not find a standard API related to it.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: How do you access country-dependent fields in BP master data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud? (e.g. Payment Ter
entry.content:
We are currently investigating how to retrieve and manage country-dependent fields in the Business Partner (BP) master data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

These fields appear under the country-specific tab in the BP UI, but it seems they are not available via standard APIs (e.g. API_BUSINESS_PARTNER) or CDS views, making it difficult to access them for reporting or integration purposes.

 

Our current (manual) process

At this time, we are checking each Business Partner individually and manually opening the country-specific section to view the data.
One field in particular, ‚ÄúPayment Terms Shift‚Äù, is critical for managing vendor payment terms, but we currently have no way to extract it automatically, resulting in a high operational burden.

 

 What we would like to ask the community:

  • In your SAP S/4HANA Cloud environment, how are you accessing or managing country-dependent fields in BP master data?

  • Do you have any examples where specific fields like Payment Terms Shift are exposed using APIs, standard reports, CDS views, or field extensions?

  • If you have implemented any workaround or workaround-based process, we would greatly appreciate your insights.

 

Any experience or knowledge you can share would be highly appreciated.
Thank you very much in advance!

entry.title: Enable purchasing info record to be used in form templates (purchasing documents)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

Is there an easy way to expose the fields in the purchasing info record to be used in the form templates for purchasing documents (e.g. Purchase Order or Purchase Contract). We can create a custom fields for on the item level for the purchasing document and then populate the values through a custom script, but I am wondering if there is an easier way.

Thanks

Thomas

entry.title: Sales Contract Shows "Completed" Before Delivery or Billing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
We observed that a Sales Contract in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition displays a status of ‚ÄúCompleted‚Äù immediately after a follow-on Sales Order is created ‚Äî even though no delivery or billing has yet occurred.

This raised a few questions:

  • Why does the contract show as Completed before delivery or billing?
  • Is this standard system behavior?
  • Can we control or delay when a contract is marked ‚ÄúCompleted‚Äù?

Looking for clarification and best practices in public cloud environments. Thank you!


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: The non-valuation of inter-projects and intra-projects stock transfers PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Subject: Inconsistent Valuation on Project-to-Project Stock Transfers (Mvt Type 344 Q and Mvt Type 343 Q)  

Dear SAP Experts, 

We are facing a critical issue with project-to-project stock transfers where the accounting posting for the stock valuation is inconsistent. Sometimes the transfer correctly generates a financial document, and other times it does not, despite using the exact same procedure. 

Business Process: 
We perform stock transfers of valuated project stock (Q-stock) between two different WBS Elements belonging to different projects. 

Applications : Transfer Stock Cross-Plant, Transfer Stock In Plant 

Movement Type: 344,343 (Special Stock Q) 

Problem Description: 

The expected behavior for a transfer posting with movement type 344 Q is the creation of both a Material Document for the quantity transfer and a corresponding Accounting Document for the value transfer. 

However, the system is failing to perform the value transfer. It only executes the physical quantity movement, leading to a critical data inconsistency: 

Receiving Project: The stock quantity is correctly increased, but it is received with zero value. 

Sending Project: The stock quantity is correctly reduced (often to zero), but it improperly retains the full inventory value. 

This results in a severe mismatch where the sending project has a monetary value with no associated stock, and the receiving project has stock with no value, corrupting our project cost and inventory reporting. 

We have been unable to identify a pattern or reason for this inconsistency. It occurs with the same material type, same movement type, and between similar project structures.

entry.title: Goods receipt to special stock type E for the cross-company code returns process.
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We are currently implementing the cross-company sales process and have set up the corresponding returns process in accordance with Scope Item 2F4. During testing, we observed that when posting the goods receipt for a return, the system does not assign Special Stock Type "E" (Orders on Hand), but instead posts the stock to Blocked Stock without any Special Stock Type.

This issue seems restricted to the context of cross-company returns. For example, if both sales organization and return plant are under the same company code, the Special Stock ‚ÄúE‚Äù assignment works correctly.

We have confirmed that our item category, schedule line category, movement type (657), and plant configuration are correctly maintained. However, the expected special stock behavior is missing only for cross-company returns.

Can you please clarify:

  • Is this standard system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
  • If yes, what is the recommendation for tracking returned stock by sales order in such scenarios?
  • Are there workarounds or extensibility options available?

Thank you in advance.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 Migration Cockpit: Material Does Not Exist Or Is Not Activated
entry.content:
I am running data migration activities in the public cloud edition using the migration cockpit application, specifically, I am working on migrating material master data using the standard "Product" template.

I have successfully uploaded the file and passed through the mapping tasks and the preparation steps, but when I attempt to run a simulation, I keep getting this error message:

"The material 1 does not exist or is not activated"

 

I've looked through the template and all of the mandatory fields have been filled in correctly, and there are no other field specific validation/mapping issues that would be causing this. There are unfortunately no other details that would help pinpoint the root cause of these errors.

Has anyone had a similar experience and how did you resolve it?
